channel.title: 3D realms not bust!
channel.description:
[quote="cooper"]http://www.gamespot.com/news/6209901.html?tag=latestheadlines;title;4 Apparently, they're not going out of business... [quote] "Despite rumors and statements to the contrary, 3D Realms (3DR) has not closed and is not closing," reads the statement. "3DR retains ownership of the Duke Nukem franchise. Due to lack of funding, however, we are saddened to confirm that we let the Duke Nukem Forever (DNF) development team go on May 6, while we regroup as a company. While 3DR is a much smaller studio now, we will continue to operate as a company and continue to license and co-create games based upon the Duke Nukem franchise."[/quote][/quote] I know I didn't believe it when I read it!
Veteran games developer 3D Realms has closed down because of a lack of funds. Founded in 1987, the firm popularised the concept of shareware gaming and published the seminal Duke Nukem and Wolfenstein 3D first-person shooters.
sauce: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8037688.stm

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

http://www.gamespot.com/news/6209901.html?tag=latestheadlines;title;4
Apparently, they’re not going out of business…

"Despite rumors and statements to the contrary, 3D Realms (3DR) has not closed and is not closing," reads the statement. "3DR retains ownership of the Duke Nukem franchise. Due to lack of funding, however, we are saddened to confirm that we let the Duke Nukem Forever (DNF) development team go on May 6, while we regroup as a company. While 3DR is a much smaller studio now, we will continue to operate as a company and continue to license and co-create games based upon the Duke Nukem franchise."

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:21, topic:277895”]I saw the news a couple of days ago… R.I.P swine kicking Duke :!
I guess it took 3D Realms ‘for ever’.

Though I wasn’t a big fan of the evercomming Duke Nukem Forever, specially when I saw the screenshots of it. They should’ve let the Duke alone and leave it for what it was. Because now a days it can’t offer what other games could offer. Back in those days of the Duke saga it was that dynamic feeling the game had and the big gore factor, which has been surpased by a couple of games now a days. So I’d say leave the game at the grave yard but release the source code![/quote]I think I love you, only for the fact that your quote has the words “source code”

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

I saw the news a couple of days ago… R.I.P swine kicking Duke :!
I guess it took 3D Realms ‘for ever’.

Though I wasn’t a big fan of the evercomming Duke Nukem Forever, specially when I saw the screenshots of it. They should’ve let the Duke alone and leave it for what it was. Because now a days it can’t offer what other games could offer. Back in those days of the Duke saga it was that dynamic feeling the game had and the big gore factor, which has been surpased by a couple of games now a days. So I’d say leave the game at the grave yard but release the source code!

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

xEnt:

its about time, 3D realms have been yabbering on about ‘Duke Nukem Forever’ forever now, yet no proof of development was shown, it was all talk and nothing ever happened. Disappointed their fans and this is clear proof nothing was happening.

Official Trailer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cWuteFLUPSY

Gameplay Footage: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DX9Yih9HEfE

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:6, topic:277895”]I dunno, they made some really crap games too. Like Prey.

But I guess they can’t all be good.[/quote]
If that was bad not weird they was not able to continue, with no real games since 2003 except prey that was crap.
There is no garanty that game would be good even if they used long time on it (Since constantly upgrading the graphic would take some time and updating lots of other things too.).

24gng1y.jpg815×492

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @PKERZ PKERZ
item.description:
@PKERZ wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:15, topic:277895”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=366806.msg2779904#msg2779904 date=1241754352]

Wasn’t Wolfenstein an ID game?

published by 3d realms
[/quote]

Gotcha.

They should have at least released the source code for their games before they went bust.[/quote]
It is not too late quite yet… So they could still be releasing it (although I doubt it), who know?

Read full topic

item.title: 3D realms not bust!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“cooper”]http://www.gamespot.com/news/6209901.html?tag=latestheadlines;title;4
Apparently, they’re not going out of business…

[quote]
“Despite rumors and statements to the contrary, 3D Realms (3DR) has not closed and is not closing,” reads the statement. “3DR retains ownership of the Duke Nukem franchise. Due to lack of funding, however, we are saddened to confirm that we let the Duke Nukem Forever (DNF) development team go on May 6, while we regroup as a company. While 3DR is a much smaller studio now, we will continue to operate as a company and continue to license and co-create games based upon the Duke Nukem franchise.”[/quote][/quote]

I know I didn’t believe it when I read it!

Veteran games developer 3D Realms has closed down because of a lack of funds.

Founded in 1987, the firm popularised the concept of shareware gaming and published the seminal Duke Nukem and Wolfenstein 3D first-person shooters.

sauce: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8037688.stm
